intro: Conostegia sororia, commonly known as the white flame tree, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered white to pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are usually hairy on the underside. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Conostegia sororia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
